One who pieces; a patcher.
a separate part of a whole
paper with a crinkled texture
someone unpleasantly strange or eccentric

a long narrative poem telling of a hero's deeds

A cep type of mushroom.
fully developed or matured and ready to be eaten or used
grains used as food either unpolished or more often polished
a platform built out from the shore into the water and supported by piles

Alternative spelling of père.
a person who is of equal standing with another in a group
the fleshy, waxy covering at the base of the upper beak of some birds
City in United States of America (Proper noun)

a form of entertainment that enacts a story by sound and a sequence of images giving the illusion of continuous movement
liquid excretory product

a dissolute man in fashionable society
informal abbreviation of `representative'

A recommendation or suggestion.
dish baked in pastry-lined pan often with a pastry top
water frozen in the solid state
a strong emotion
